ASSAY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION: human NNF (hNNF) assay. A co-culture comprised of human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC)-derived excitatory and inhibitory neurons as well as primary human astroglia was differentiated for 35 days on microelectrode arrays (MEA), and spontaneous electrical activity, together with cytotoxicity, was assessed on a weekly basis after washout of the compounds 24 h prior to measurements.
AOP: stressor-specific adverse outcome pathway (AOP) network associated with a plausible molecular initiating event for deltamethrin
CELL_LINE: human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC)-derived excitatory and inhibitory neurons; primary human astroglia
CELL_FORMAT: co-culture ... differentiated for 35 days on microelectrode arrays (MEA)
RESPONSE: identifying their DNT potential by evaluation of specific spike-, burst-, and network parameters
BIOLOGICAL_PROCESS_TARGET: key neurodevelopmental processes (KNDP), including the formation and function of neural networks
TISSUE: co-culture comprised of human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC)-derived excitatory and inhibitory neurons as well as primary human astroglia

ASSAY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION: human neural progenitor cell (hNPC) proliferation and apoptosis
BIOLOGICAL_PROCESS_TARGET: human neural progenitor cell (hNPC) proliferation and apoptosis

ASSAY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION: human neural network formation (hNNF) assay based on a commercially available kit, which consists of hiPSC-derived excitatory and inhibitory neurons and primary astroglia (SynFire, NeuCyte, USA)
EVENT: detect alterations by bisindolylmaleimide I (Bis-I) via a known mode of action (MoA); compound-specific effects on network development
CELL_LINE: hiPSC-derived excitatory and inhibitory neurons and primary astroglia (SynFire, NeuCyte, USA)
RESPONSE: spontaneous neuronal activity with organized spiking and bursting patterns, which can be modulated with known neurotoxicants and drugs; compound-specific effects on network development
BIOLOGICAL_PROCESS_TARGET: formation and function of neural networks; synaptogenesis and neuronal activity
